name: seawater reverse osmosis module production, 8-inch spiral wound, enhanced | seawater reverse osmosis module | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11699/documentation

This dataset represents the production of seawater reverse osmosis membrane module. This dataset is scaled to 1 m2 of active membrane surface for water filtration.  Enhanced module is based on Dow chemical 8-inches spiral wound modules SW30XLE-440i and is considered to have 40.9 m2 of active surface per module. Enhanced module refers to membrane that can support higher operating pressure with a maximum of 1200 psig (83 bars).   

From reception of raw materials for production of membrane module. 

This dataset ends with production of module for seawater reverse osmosis desalination process. This dataset only includes material inputs for production and energy for recycling a recirculated solvent. Most losses and processing for materials have been excluded due to lack of data. Thus no waste are considered. Production energy is also excluded due to lack of  data.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From composition of a nano-filtration module to a seawater reverseosmosis module from the same company. Extrapolation was achived using literature data (articles, patent, spec sheets, etc.)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: General rules for inventories for 8 inches spiral wound modules are derived from the autopsy of a NF70-400 module (Dow Chemical) and data from patent and technical litterature.

exchanges.description: This unit process refers to the unit of active membrane surface for reverse osmosis of seawater within of 8 inches spiral wound module.

flow.name: seawater reverse osmosis module
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

exchanges.description: Extrapolated process. This process reprensents mass trichlorotrifluoroethane (CFC-113) used as solvent for  trimesoyl chloride (TMC) in second reaction for polyamide layer in-situ formation. Part of solvent is recycled and recirculated internally. Only part not recycled is considered which correspond to 5% of total solvent in reaction (solution 0.1%TMC). These losses are considered volatilised. Data published in part in Bonton. 2012.
